intro: Scaphochlamys longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-stemmed hooded orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a hood-like labellum and elongated peduncles. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist habitats. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pale pink. The botanical features of Scaphochlamys longipedunculata make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
